Package se.cbb.jprime.topology

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AcyclicDigraph
    Interface for implementations of acyclic digraphs (commonly referred to as 'DAGs').
    Graph
    Base interface for implementations of graphs, whether directed, partially directed or undirected.
    GraphMap
    Interface for holders of per-vertex values for a graph G, e.g.
    RootedBifurcatingTree
    Specialisation constraining a rooted tree to be bifurcating, i.e.
    RootedBifurcatingTreeParameter
    Union of rooted bifurcating tree and state parameter.
    RootedTree
    Specialised interface for a multifurcating rooted tree, required to consist of one sole component with at least one vertex.
    RootedTreeParameter
    Union of rooted tree and state parameter.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BooleanMap
    Holds a boolean for each vertex of a graph.
    DoubleArrayMap
    Holds a double array for each vertex of a graph.
    DoubleArrayMatrixMap
    Holds a double array for each pair (x,y) of vertices of a graph.
    DoubleMap
    Holds a double for each vertex of a graph.
    GenericMap<T extends org.jfree.util.PublicCloneable>
    Holds an object for each vertex of a graph.
    GuestHostMap
    Holds a list of guest tree leaf names and a list of host tree leaf names, and mappings between them.
    IntArrayMap
    Holds an int array for each vertex of a graph.
    IntMap
    Holds an int for each vertex of a graph.
    LeafLeafMap
    Very simple map linking each leaf in a guest topology G to its leaf in a host topology S.
    MPRMap
    Extends a guest-host map with functionality concerning the most parsimonious reconciliation when embedding the guest tree in the host tree using duplication and loss events.
    NamesMap
    Extension of a StringMap, where vertex/arc indices may be retrieved from names (and vice versa).
    NeighbourJoiningTreeGenerator
    Tree generator which computes an (arbitrarily rooted) bifurcating Neighbour Joining (NJ) tree based on sequence identity (not more fancy sequence evolution than that!).
    RBTree
    Implementation of a rooted binary tree topology (the name does not refer to the data structure red-black tree!) Internally, parents, left and right children are stored in arrays indexed by vertex number.
    RBTreeArcDiscretiser
    Discretises an ultrametric host tree by splitting every arc into a number of equidistant slices.
    RBTreeBranchSwapper
    Proposer which perturbs the topology of a bifurcating rooted tree.
    ReconciledRBTreeGenerator
    Given a guest-to-host leaf map and a host tree, provides means for generating a reconciled guest tree.
    RTree
    Implementation of a rooted multifurcating tree topology where parents, and children are stored in arrays indexed by vertex number (the children of a specified vertex are, in turn, held as an array in no particular order).
    StringMap
    Holds a string for each vertex of a graph.
    TestBioJavaPhylo  
    TestRBTreeArcDiscretiser
    JUnit test case.
    TestReconciledRBTreeGenerator
    JUnit test case.
    TestRTree
    JUnit test case.
    TestUniformRBTreeGenerator
    JUnit test case.
    TimesMap
    Specialisation of a DoubleMap to hold times of an ultrametric tree.
    TreeAlgorithms
    Algorithms pertaining to trees not already in the tree implementations themselves.
    UniformRBTreeGenerator
    Provides means for generating a uniform tree.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    TreePropertyCoverage
    Simple enumeration which can be used for specifying how much of a tree (vertices or arcs) some property or characteristic (e.g.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    TopologyException
    Exception raised when errors concerning topology occur (tree copying, erroneous arcs, topology-map mismatch, etc.).
